remarks: An alternate definition of proper substitution ~ df-sb .  By introducing a dummy variable ` z ` in the definiens, we are able to eliminate any distinct variable restrictions among the variables ` x ` , ` y ` , and ` ph ` of the definiendum.  No distinct variable conflicts arise because ` z ` effectively insulates ` x ` from ` y ` .  To achieve this, we use a chain of two substitutions in the form of ~ sb5 , first ` z ` for ` x ` then ` y ` for ` z ` .  Compare Definition 2.1'' of [Quine] p. 17, which is obtained from this theorem by applying ~ df-clab .  Theorem ~ sb7h provides a version where ` ph ` and ` z ` don't have to be distinct.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jan-2004.)
statement:
dfsb7 $p |- ( [ y / x ] ph <-> E. z ( z = y /\ E. x ( x = z /\ ph ) ) ) $.
$d ph z $.
$d y z $.
